content.explanation:
The vertical line test is like having a superpower to instantly tell if a graph shows a function!

🔍 THE TEST: Draw (or imagine) a vertical line anywhere on the graph
✅ If the line touches the graph at ONLY ONE point → It's a function
❌ If the line touches the graph at MORE THAN ONE point → Not a function

Why does this work? A vertical line represents the same x-value (input). If it hits the graph twice, that means one input gives two outputs - breaking the function rule!
content.example:
🎯 Quick examples:
• Parabola (y = x²): Passes test ✅
• Circle: Fails test ❌ (vertical line through middle hits twice)
• Straight line: Passes test ✅
content.key_point: Vertical line test checks the 'one input → one output' rule visually.
